m_szDocSumamry: textArticle -------------------- U.S. stocks fall for the fourth straight day New York Stock Exchange Traders work at the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday. Traders work at the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday. (Mark Lennihan / Associated Press) Privacy Policy Jitters over the global economy and a steep drop in crude oil prices knocked U.S. stocks lower for the fourth day in a row Thursday. The drop in the U.S. followed large losses all around the world, and left all three major U.S. indexes down at least 10% since the beginning of the year.
